name: Building a web app with Polymer web components
description:
The web as an application platform is advancing rapidly. Come learn about web components and how to build them easily using the Polymer library. (https://www.polymer-project.org/1.0/)

We'll show how to build a custom HTML element that is reusable anywhere, and how to assemble custom elements into larger bits of functionality, even entire applications.

Food and beverages will be provided. There is free parking available in the lot behind the building or in street spots. Agenda:
6PM People arriving, chatting, food and drinks available
6:30 PolymerJS talk starts
7:30-8 Free hack time and networking

The event will be streamed and recorded on a Hangout on Air here https://plus.google.com/b/111439872924209508980/events/cfl35dqki0vdv5da8euet0r5ujs. 

Any code will be up on the GDG Missoula github repo https://github.com/GDG-Missoula

name: Becoming Functional
description:
Here is your chance to get a soft introduction to functional programming! Using JavaScript we will look at the elementary principles of functional programming including functions, immutability, and purity. Using these fundamental principles we will learn about the Functor, a primitive concept in most functional programming languages. You may already be familiar with an existing Functor named Array! We will look at other instances of Functors and how to use them to make your code more reasonable and effective.

Rough Agenda: 
6:00 - 6:30 Arrive, Food & Drinks, Social time 
6:30 - 7:30 Ben Campbell presents on functional programming, questions and discussion follows 
7:30 - 8:00 Finish up the drinks, more social time

Thanks to Submittable for hosting the space, food and drinks!

name: Progressive Web Apps Summit Viewing Party + Codelabs
description:
Progressive Web Applications take advantage of new technologies to bring the best of mobile sites and native applications to users. They're reliable, fast, and engaging.

The PWA Dev Summit 2016 is on June 20th and 21st!  But, it is in Amsterdam, so watching the livestream is going to be very early in the morning in Montana.  Let us help you carve out time to watch some of the talks by joining us for a watching party!  

Rough Agenda: 
6:00 - 6:30 Arrival, food & drinks, social time 

6:30 - 7:00 

PWA Summit Keynote

Thao Tran and Alex Russell

It's now possible to build fast, engaging, reliable mobile web experiences that are great for users and good for businesses. We'll kick off the two day summit with an overview of Progressive Web Apps as well as strategies for how you can integrate these new technologies into your own site.

7:00 - 8:00 

Option 1: Instant-loading offline-first progressive web apps the next generation part II uncovered

Jake Archibald

For most of the web, poor network connectivity destroys the user experience. We can do better. In this session we'll take an online-only site and turn it into a fully network-resilient, offline-first installable progressive web app. We'll also break out of the app shell and look at approaches that better-suit traditional server-driven sites.

-- OR --

Option 2: Progressive Web App codelabs

8:00 - 8:30 Finish up the drinks, more social time

Thanks to Workiva for hosting the space, food and drinks!

name: Building For the Web with Workiva Open Source Projects
description:
Workiva utilizes the Dart programming language and tools to develop their client-side web applications. During the last few years, we have open sourced several key parts of our platform. We will look at w_module to see how application lifecycle is managed. The over_react and w_flux libraries will illustrate how complex components can be composed, dynamically updated, and rendered quickly and efficiently. These packages are built atop React JS and implement the Flux design patterns. If you're interested in how you can create statically typed reactive web applications this talk is for you!

Pizza, beer, & Le Croix will be provided. Parking available in the lot behind the building or in street spots.

Agenda:

6PM - 6:30PM People arrive, food and mingling

6:30PM - 7:30PM Workiva Open Source Tech Talk (Ben Campbell)

7:30 - 8PM Questions, discussion, networking

name: Curated Polymer Summit Viewing
description:
Special remote GDG Missoula!  We're going to watch Polymer summit videos, at least 20% faster than real time, specially selected by your GDG organizers.  

If your are in Bozeman, join us!  We'll grab some snacks and drinks from Heebs!

name: Android Apps with Kotlin
description:
• What we'll do
George Lesica will speak on building Android apps with Kotlin.

There are a plethora of ways to build Android apps these days. One relative newcomer is Kotlin, a JVM language from JetBrains (the IDE people). It is now an official Android language and is supported in Android Studio.

Why would someone use Kotlin instead of Java? Let’s find out! We’ll take a simple Android app written in Java and convert it to Kotlin. In the process, we’ll take a look at some of the features that might make Kotlin an attractive choice for projects new and old, and we’ll discuss the pros and cons of using Kotlin for Android development.

Agenda:
6 - 6:30 Arrive, enjoy pizza & beverages, chat
6:30 ~ 7:15 Android Apps w/ Kotlin tech talk ( w/ questions & discussion )
~7:15 - ~8 : Drinks, discussion, networking

----------
Yes, this is the same event cross-posted to Montana Programmers https://www.meetup.com/Montana-Programmers/events/246759420/

• What to bring
If you'd like help getting your computer set up to build android apps with Kotlin, bring it along!

• Important to know
We strive to be an inclusive and respectful community group. As such we have a code of conduct based on the Ubuntu Code of Conduct.

Be considerate. Be respectful. Take responsibility for our words and our actions. Be collaborative.

Read the full version: https://www.ubuntu.com/about/about-ubuntu/conduct

• About the Speaker
George is a software engineer at Workiva. He works mostly in Dart and Go but is enthusiastic about new and different programming languages. He loves statically-typed languages and wringing as much value as possible out of static source code analysis. He has contributed to a variety of open source projects and projects and loves sharing what he knows (and doesn't know) with others.

name: Rust for the web
description:
Web Assembly brings exciting new possibilities to the web. It’s quickly becoming possible to run AAA games, video editing software and other applications with a serious need for speed in the browser. Rust is a systems programming language (think as fast as C/C++) focused on safety with a stated goal of first class Web Assembly support. Let’s learn a little bit about Rust, a little bit about Web Assembly and try to run an existing Rust project in the browser!

Agenda:
6 - 6:30 Arrive, enjoy pizza & beverages, chat/networking
6:30 ~ 7:30 Rust for the Web tech talk ( w/ questions & discussion )
7:30 - 8:00 Finish drinks, more networking

name: Flutter Study Jam
description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source -- https://flutter.io

Join GDG Missoula for a Flutter Study Jam! This group will meet and complete the Flutter Udacity Course, with the open door to extend our education and pursue projects as desired. The group will run from early August to the end of September.

Flutter Udacity Course: https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

By the end of this Study Jam, you should have all the tools you need to be able to jump in and create mobile apps from scratch using the Flutter framework. Everyone who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

You’ll also get to meet and create with talented and awesome local developers.

Intermediate programming experience is ideal but not required for a motivated beginner. Weekly attendance is recommended but not required.

Please do your best to set up Flutter on your computer before the meetup. It’s quite simple: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

You can also Write Your First Flutter App for extra credit prep: https://flutter.io/get-started/codelab/

More information:
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2018/06/google-flutter-mobile-development/
https://hackernoon.com/whats-revolutionary-about-flutter-946915b09514
https://hackernoon.com/what-it-was-like-to-write-a-full-blown-flutter-app-330d8202825b
https://github.com/Solido/awesome-flutter

You will need to bring your own computer (Mac, Windows, or Linux). (Chromebooks don't yet allow installation of the tools required for Flutter development)
how_to_find_us: The main entrance is on Myrtle street between 3rd and 4th

name: Flutter Study Jam
description:
**If you didn't make the last two meetups but would still like to attend, please do! We finished Lesson 1 (first half) of the Udacity course and tinkered with routing, state, and building simple widgets - https://classroom.udacity.com/courses/ud905

Please do your best to set up Flutter on your computer before the meetup. It’s quite simple: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

You can also Write Your First Flutter App for extra credit prep: https://flutter.io/get-started/codelab/

More information:
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2018/06/google-flutter-mobile-development/
https://hackernoon.com/whats-revolutionary-about-flutter-946915b09514
https://hackernoon.com/what-it-was-like-to-write-a-full-blown-flutter-app-330d8202825b
https://github.com/Solido/awesome-flutter

You will need to bring your own computer (Mac, Windows, or Linux). (Chromebooks don't yet allow installation of the tools required for Flutter development)
how_to_find_us: The main entrance is on Myrtle street between 3rd and 4th

name: Flutter Study Jam
description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source -- https://flutter.io

Join GDG Missoula for a Flutter Study Jam! This group will meet and complete the Flutter Udacity Course, with the open door to extend our education and pursue projects as desired. The group will run from early August to the end of September.

Flutter Udacity Course: https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

By the end of this Study Jam, you should have all the tools you need to be able to jump in and create mobile apps from scratch using the Flutter framework. Everyone who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

You’ll also get to meet and create with talented and awesome local developers.

Intermediate programming experience is ideal but not required for a motivated beginner. Weekly attendance is recommended but not required.

Please do your best to set up Flutter on your computer before the meetup. It’s quite simple: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

You can also Write Your First Flutter App for extra credit prep: https://flutter.io/get-started/codelab/

More information:
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2018/06/google-flutter-mobile-development/
https://hackernoon.com/whats-revolutionary-about-flutter-946915b09514
https://hackernoon.com/what-it-was-like-to-write-a-full-blown-flutter-app-330d8202825b
https://github.com/Solido/awesome-flutter

You will need to bring your own computer (Mac, Windows, or Linux). (Chromebooks don't yet allow installation of the tools required for Flutter development)
how_to_find_us: The main entrance is on Myrtle street between 3rd and 4th

name: Flutter Live Viewing Party
description:
We'll be hosting a viewing party for the Flutter Live event in London.
More info https://developers.google.com/events/flutter-live/

This will be a pretty casual event. Stop on by and celebrate with others who are excited about Flutter and Dart!

The keynote starts at 10AM!

name: GDG Holiday Party
description:
Join us for an evening of free arcade games, free tacos, and free beer to celebrate the awesome tech community in Missoula, the events we've thrown this year, the learning we've done, the connections we've made, and all that is to come in the new year.

We're renting out the basement of the Gild.

This event is the source of truth - please RSVP here so we know how many to expect!

Sponsored by GDG Missoula & MT Programmers
Partnered with MissoulaTech
